frameDefinitions: In this frame a group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration.
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
The words in this frame describe entities that occur in some temporally-ordered sequence.

A Figure is located relative to a (presumably more easily located) Ground, asserting that the Figure lies (approximately) on line from the Ground whose direction is established by semantic types of the particular LUs.
This Frame is concerned with evaluating an Evaluee as being suitable for a Purpose or a User, presupposing some choice that is being made about which Evaluee to use for the Purpose or User.
This frame is about Items in the state of occupying a certain Rank within a hierarchy.
frameExamples: The crowd <t>came together</t> in the courtyard.
Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
Describe in detail the <t>sequence</t> of steps taken during an emergency.
The plane landed 10 miles due <t>north</t> of Lake Travis in an empty field .
(1) We need to build more houses <t>suitable</t> for local residents.
He <t>ranks</t> second in his class in mathematics.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Individuals</fen> are self-movers who come together.
The <fen>Configuration</fen> describes the resulting formation of the individuals.
<fen>Party_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in the congregating event.
A grammatically less prominent participant in the congregating event.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the congregating occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the congregating occurs.
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.
This entity occurs in some sequence with <fen>Entity_2</fen>.
This entity occurs in some sequence with respect to <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
<fen>Entities</fen> that occur in some temporal order.
A characterization of the sequence in which the entities occur.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.

The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location in a certain direction specified by the particular LU. The <fen>Figure</fen> can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
This Frame Element marks constituents expressing the entity that is judged to be more or less suitable for some <fen>Purpose</fen> or <fen>User</fen>.
This Frame Element marks constituents that express the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged to be suitable or unsuitable.
This role marks expressions that indicate a <fen>User</fen> to whom
The <fen>Rank</fen> which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The Item which occupies the Rank in the hierarchy.
The dimension along which the ranking is defined.
The time at which/period over which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies the <fen>Rank</fen>
listRoleExamples: <fex>The crowd</fex> gathered on the streets of Paris.
<fex>Our group</fex> met with theirs in the plaza.
Our group met <fex>with theirs</fex> in the plaza.
The study consisted of a <fex>chronologically varied</fex> SERIES of grotesque heads.
He was north of the park <fex>on Friday</fex>.
Being a project leader is not a job for which <fex>everybody</fex> is suited.
We need to plan more buildings suitable <fex>for disabled people</fex>.
He ranks second in his class <fex>in mathematics</fex>.
Jim ranked as thirty-second degree Mason <fex>in 1970</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Enna for the Gran Premio del Mediterraneo
